  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours
    | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday
    Morning | Face The
    Nation 















Hi everyone,
 
Today a Defense Department panel warned that more
  than one-third of U.S.
  troops and veterans suffer from mental health problems such as traumatic
  brain injury or post-traumatic stress disorder. With the conflicts in Iraq and Afghanistan continuing, these
  numbers are only expected to grow, according to the group. David Martin will
  have this story and a deeper look at veterans’ mental health issues.
 
Correspondent Allen Pizzey will introduce you to an
  Army specialist with a special perseverance – and a unique perspective
  on the roadside attacks that injure so many American troops: Specialist
  Jordan Spurlin has survived four IED explosions. Now he’s sharing his
  story.
 
A boat carrying an estimated 150 Haitian migrants
  capsized in the Atlantic Ocean this morning.
  Kelly Cobiella will have the latest on the Coast Guard’s frantic search
  for survivors.
 
Ten presidential hopefuls lined up on stage last
  night, but what memorable about it? Our senior political correspondent Jeff
  Greenfield will have a review of the first Republican debate.
 
Queen Elizabeth II is causing quite a stir at the
  site of one of America’s
  first colonies. Mark Phillips will follow her through Jamestown – where Brits settled 400
  years ago – and take a look back through its history and how it is
  recently being revised.
 
A bit of trivia: Who is the only sitting U.S. senator to serve on active duty in Iraq?
  Sharyl Attkisson will have that exclusive story tonight, and she’ll
  explain the work this lawmaker has done recently for the military.
 
Finally, for Assignment America Steve Hartman will
  have a sugar-sweet story about a small-town family fighting to save their
  roots – one hand-dipped chocolate at a time. 
 
I hope you join us tonight and have a great weekend,
 




Katie Couric
CouricandCo@cbs.com
